intro: Chrysopsis echioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Chrysopsis echioides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
